Recent? Letterpress? Any info on source or date?  
Don
Bet it is photo polymer letterpress and maybe started out as Illustrator art work.

I think you are correct Bob. I have been collecting interesting ampersands for years and I don't have this one.  
But there are now many well styled fonts that would harmonize with this ampersand, so I will keep an open mind.  
BTW, I like the design. Worth including in an appropriate swashed Roman with similar terminals.  
Don
I agree Don, it is a very nice variant on the ampersand.

Unfortunately, when the image is corrected for rotation, skew and perspective it looses some of its extravagant swash and is not quite so dramatic

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141010043623im_/http:/typophile.com/files/AmpersandElegantSerifTypophile120272correctedSM_5030.jpg)
  
But its still a nice design.  
Don

So, do either of you have a suggestion as to what the base font might be (I suspect it's a custom creation, but it has to be based on something)?

After editing out the swash, Seravee is the only near match that I could get (and it only comes somewhat close):  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/stawix/seravee/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141010043623/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/stawix/seravee/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/stawix/seravee/")
Maybe started with a reversed 3 - I will look into that.
